intro: Neolloydia mariposensis, commonly known as the Mariposa lily, is a striking plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant thrives in cool, high-altitude environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. Neolloydia mariposensis is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological significance in its native ecosystems.
